definition: can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very

sentences.english: The proposition is simple and straightforward, and its equities unassailable.
sentences.chinese: 這份提議簡單而直接，其公平也無懈可擊。

sentences.english: Jeff's hardheaded analysis does not stop at why and how to do all this.
sentences.chinese: 薩克斯無懈可擊的分析，並不止步於推導和建議。

sentences.english: Mr Sympson proved to be a man of spotless respectability.
sentences.chinese: 辛普森先生原來就是一位無懈可擊的體面人物。

sentences.english: He might have been called the invulnerable dwarf of the fray.
sentences.chinese: 可以說，他是混戰中的一個無懈可擊的侏儒。

sentences.english: His team does freelance work for banks and businesses in need of airtight security.
sentences.chinese: 他的團隊爲需要無懈可擊安全的銀行和商行義務勞動。

sentences.english: He's proven himself unassailable and indeed untouchable.
sentences.chinese: 他證明自己是無懈可擊的，事實上不可觸摸的。

sentences.english: He was always composed; his manners, except on one or two occasions, were impeccable .
sentences.chinese: 他一直神態自若，除一兩次外，舉止態度都無懈可擊。

sentences.english: So long as he stayed there his position was unassailable.
sentences.chinese: 只要他在那他的立場就無懈可擊。

sentences.english: The authors of last weeks paper, however, defend their findings.
sentences.chinese: 然而，這篇論文的作者認爲自己的發現無懈可擊。

sentences.english: Recently a series of experiments have suggested that classic Mendelian genetics is not the whole story.
sentences.chinese: 最近一系列實現表明孟德爾基因說並非無懈可擊。

sentences.english: Complex intrigues where the hero must thwart the subtle machinations of seemingly unbeatable opponents.
sentences.chinese: 勇者必須破解近乎無懈可擊的強敵所編織的詭詐陰謀。

sentences.english: one day, has not been able again to come.
sentences.chinese: 無懈可擊之高手如林天過完，不會再來。
這是個無懈可擊的觀點。

sentences.english: We enjoyed a spotlessly clean record .
This has been a season when everything has come together to make his candidacy unimpeachable .
sentences.chinese: 特別是今年，他的當選是無懈可擊，水到渠成的。

sentences.english: A judge's ethics should be unexceptionable.
sentences.chinese: 法官的職業道德必須是無懈可擊的。

definition: handling a butcher's cleaver with ease (idiom); to do sth skillfully and easily
to remain calm in the face of events (idiom)
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
hard to distinguish real from imitation
